Senior Android QA Automation Tester

18 000 - 22 000 PLN
Net per month - B2B
Save
Apply

Senior Android QA Automation Tester
Senior Android QA Automation Tester

co.brick sp. z o.o.

Full-time
B2B
Senior
Remote
TECH STACK
QA
Master
Mobile App Testing
Master
Android
Master
JOB DESCRIPTION

The Senior Android QA Automation Tester plays a vital role in ensuring the quality and reliability of Android applications through the design, development, and execution of advanced automated testing strategies. This position requires deep technical expertise in Android platforms and testing frameworks, along with strong collaboration skills to work effectively with developers, product managers, UX designers, and DevOps teams.

The ideal candidate will take ownership of the Android testing lifecycle, contribute to architecture decisions for test automation, and promote best practices such as Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Behavior-Driven Development (BDD). A strong focus on CI/CD integration, mobile-specific testing challenges (such as device fragmentation and performance), and continuous improvement is key.




Key Accountabilities:

Design, implement, and maintain scalable and reliable automated test frameworks for Android applications.

Develop and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts for functional, regression, and performance testing.

Collaborate closely with Android developers and cross-functional teams to understand requirements and provide early feedback through automated testing.

Integrate automated tests within CI/CD pipelines

Drive mobile testing best practices, including testing on real devices and emulators, parallel execution, and handling OS-specific behaviours.

Advocate for quality across the development lifecycle by participating in code reviews, sprint planning, and release planning.

Troubleshoot and isolate complex issues, providing detailed documentation and feedback to development teams.

Mentor and guide junior QA engineers in test automation strategy and implementation.




Required skills and Experience

Professional level (6+ years’ experience) as an Automation QA with at least 4 years focused on Android mobile apps.

Proficiency in Kotlin and familiarity with Espresso, UI Automator, or other Android test automation frameworks.

Solid understanding of Android architecture, UI/UX patterns, and mobile testing challenges.

Strong knowledge of CI/CD systems and integration of automated tests into build pipelines.

Experience working with tools such as Appium, Firebase Test Lab, BrowserStack, or similar.

Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development processes.

Excellent problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.




Desired skills & experience

Previous experience in the payments industry or with PCI DSS compliance is advantageous.

Experience with performance, security, or accessibility testing on Android.

Knowledge of REST API testing tools such as Postman or REST-assured.

Exposure to cross-platform mobile testing (e.g., Flutter, React Native).

JOB DESCRIPTION

Job Title: Senior QA Automation Engineer (C#/.NET)




About the Role

We are looking for an experienced Senior QA Automation Engineer to join our Poland-based QA team and contribute to a long-term transformation program in the insurance and claims management domain. You will play a key role in shaping our test automation strategy, developing reliable test frameworks, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality software solutions.




Your responsibilities will include:

Designing, writing, and maintaining automated test scripts (API and UI) in C#.

Contributing to backend and frontend automation frameworks.

Performing manual testing where needed to ensure comprehensive coverage.

Executing and analyzing performance tests, reporting results to stakeholders.

Supporting user acceptance testing (UAT) by assisting end users.

Providing QA estimates during sprint planning and refinement sessions.

Coaching and mentoring other QA team members.

Actively collaborating in Scrum teams and improving QA processes.




Requirements:

5+ years of experience in software testing, including 3+ years in automation (API and UI).

Strong programming skills in C# with ability to write and review code (not only run scripts).

Solid knowledge of OOP principles, SOLID, and testing methodologies.

Hands-on experience in API testing (REST#), microservice architecture, and CRUD services.

Experience with automation tools such as Selenium, Xray, Visual Studio, Git, and Page Object Model.

Knowledge of SQL Server and T-SQL.

Previous experience working in Agile/Scrum teams with JIRA.

Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and willingness to contribute to both automated and manual testing.

Excellent communication skills, with ability to collaborate effectively in distributed teams.




Nice to have:

UI automation experience.

Experience in performance testing.

Familiarity with Microsoft Azure or cloud-based platforms.




Tech Stack:

.NET / C#, API-centric test automation, UI automation, Git/version control.




What we offer:

Permanent, full-time engagement in a long-term international program.

Opportunity to work with modern technologies in a strategic transformation project.

Collaborative environment with both automation and manual testers.

Possibility to grow as an expert in cloud-based insurance systems.

QA Automation Engineer (Python)

2 000 - 3 300 EUR
Gross per month - Any
Save
Apply
All offers

QA Automation Engineer (Python)
Testing

Rondo Daszyńskiego, Warszawa +4 Locations

Andersen

Full-time
Any
Mid
Remote
TECH STACK
English
B1
Selenium
Regular
API Testing
Regular
pytest
Regular
Python
Regular
Qase

JOB DESCRIPTION

Andersen is hiring a QA Automation Engineer (Python) for a project with a global mobile game developer. The role focuses on automating tests for a custom game engine to improve test coverage and development efficiency. 

 

The customer is a leading global developer and publisher of mobile games, operating across more than 50 countries. With a team of over 3,000 professionals, the company is recognized as one of the top three mobile gaming studios worldwide by revenue. Its portfolio includes several hit titles that consistently rank among the highest-grossing games in app stores, attracting over 100 million monthly active users. The customer emphasizes innovation, long-term player engagement, and high production quality. 

 

The project is focused on automating complex technical debt test cases related to a custom game engine, similar to Unity and written in C++. This engine is used for game development, and the automated testing aims to improve coverage and efficiency across key engine functionalities. 

 

Responsibilities: 

- Designing, developing, and maintaining automated test frameworks. 

- Writing and executing automated tests for web interfaces and API testing. 

- Refactoring existing tests to align with the new Page Object Model architecture. 

- Managing test results and documentation. 

- Integrating automated tests into CI/CD pipelines. 

- Collaborating with customer teams to ensure high-quality delivery and alignment with project requirements. 

 

Must-haves: 

- Experience in QA Automation for 3+ years. - Experience with invasive frameworks that provide access to models inside the editor. - Proficiency in Python and experience with Pytest. - Familiarity with QASE for test management.- Skills in using Teamcity and GitHub. - Experience in creating tests using PageObject and Factory patterns. - Knowledge of testing tools such as Selenium (for web testing) and API testing (via websocket). - Ability to work with APIs through websocket. - Exceptional communication and teamwork skills, focused on collaborative problem-solving. - Level of English – from Intermediate and above. 

 

Nice-to-haves: 

- Experience working as a lead or a desire to work as a lead of Andersen AQA team. - Experience or understanding of the testing process in gamedev industry. 

 

Reasons why this job would be interesting to you: 

- Experience in teamwork with leaders in FinTech, Healthcare, Retail, Telecom, and others. Andersen cooperates with such businesses as Samsung, Siemens, Johnson & Johnson, BNP Paribas, Ryanair, Mercedes, TUI, Verivox, Allianz, T-Systems, etc.

- The opportunity to change the project and/or develop expertise in an interesting business domain. 

- Job conditions – you can work both fully remotely and from the office or can choose a hybrid variant. 

- Guarantee of professional, financial, and career growth! The company has introduced systems of mentoring and adaptation for each new employee. 

- The opportunity to earn up to an additional 1,000 USD per month, depending on the level of expertise, which will be included in the annual bonus, by participating in the company's activities.   

- Access to the corporate training portal, where the entire knowledge base of the company is collected and which is constantly updated. 

- Bright corporate life (parties / pizza days / PlayStation / fruits / coffee / snacks / movies). 

- Certification compensation (AWS, PMP, etc). 

- Referral program. 

- English courses. 

- Private health insurance and compensation for sports activities. 

 

Your personal data is protected in accordance with GDPR regulations. Learn more: https://andersenlab.com/privacy-policy/pl

 

Join us!

JOB DESCRIPTION

Senior QA Automation Engineer – Data Migration Project

Do zespołu technologicznego pracującego nad greenfieldowym projektem migracji danych poszukujemy doświadczonego QA Automation Engineera. Projekt polega na zastąpieniu starszego systemu analitycznego nową platformą opartą o ClickHouse – skalowalną bazę danych zoptymalizowaną pod analizy czasu rzeczywistego. Zespół QA będzie dedykowany wyłącznie testom migracyjnym (dane, performance, zgodność), niezależnie od istniejącego QA dla głównej aplikacji.




Szukamy osób, które nie tylko dobrze odnajdują się w automatyzacji testów, ale także potrafią projektować frameworki testowe od zera, myślą analitycznie i dobrze rozumieją procesy ETL.




Zakres obowiązków:

Budowa frameworku testowego do weryfikacji jakości migracji danych (funkcjonalność, integralność, performance)

Pisanie testów automatycznych (API, BDD, performance)

Bliska współpraca z zespołem developerskim oraz analitykami danych

Praca z bazami danych (PostgreSQL, Spark SQL, ClickHouse)

Udział w codziennych stand-upach, planowaniu i przeglądach sprintów




Wymagania:

Minimum 8 lat doświadczenia zawodowego, w tym 5+ w automatyzacji

Bardzo dobra znajomość Java

Doświadczenie w: Cucumber (BDD), Postman, JMeter/LoadRunner, SQL, Azure DevOps

Umiejętność projektowania i wdrażania własnych frameworków testowych

Doświadczenie w środowiskach Agile/Scrum

Wysoka komunikatywność i samodzielność




Mile widziane:

Znajomość zagadnień z obszaru finansów (clearing, prime brokerage)

Doświadczenie w projektach greenfield, migracjach danych




📍 Lokalizacja: Warszawa (hybrydowo: 3 dni biuro / 2 dni zdalnie)

🕓 Start: ASAP lub do 1 miesiąca

💼 Forma współpracy: B2B

📅 Długość projektu: długoterminowy kontrakt

👥 Liczba wakatów: 2

JOB DESCRIPTION

Our customer is embarking on an exciting and challenging transformation program and our software solutions are a driving force behind this strategy to deliver cloud-based computing and leading-edge design and architecture to our business.

The Senior QA Tester Automation Engineer is a key member of our Quality team working on a variety of projects within a distributed scrum environment across EU

The Senior QA Tester Automation Engineer will work with the rest of the QA team to record and automate test scripts using C# and a range of toolsets and following the standards set out. 

The Senior QA Tester Automation Engineer will become an expert in our strategic technology platform, built in Microsoft Azure, servicing our regional and global client base within the Insurance industry.

Key Responsibilities: 

Writing automated test scripts to verify and validate that the new software meets the business needs

Gaining a strong understanding of the business operation

Recording and monitoring QA test results

Enhancing existing automation back end and front end framework 

Providing coaching support to others in the QA team

Providing QA effort estimates in work refinement sessions

Helping to drive the test automation strategy across the business

Running performance tests and ensuring that the results meet established levels

Assisting in the user acceptance test (UAT) process by helping end users understand how to use the software

Be an active member of the Scrum team, improving processes and ensuring that the team delivers on their commitment

Knowledge and Skills required:

5+ years of experience in testing (with at least 3 years in UI/API automation).

Sound knowledge and experience of Web Application testing including API testing using Rest #.

Knowledge of OOP, SOLID, and other principles

Experience in testing systems with a microservice architecture

Knowledge of how CRUD services work

Experience using C# language.

Experience with software QA processes, methodologies, and tools. 

Experience and desire to perform Manual testing

Sound knowledge of SQL server and TSQL, Visual Studio, Git, Selenium, Xray and Page Object Model.

Knowledge of current industry-wide quality & test processes, practices, tools and techniques.

Self-organizing problem solver with the ability to think outside the box.

Works effectively with both local and remote colleagues, collaborating, motivating, and energizing others.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong attention to detail.

Continuously looking to improve and learn new technologies, participating actively in the development community, contributing to blogs, researching or Opensource.

Enjoys working in a fast-paced environment.

Experience required:

Previous experience working in medium-sized development teams.

Experience working in an agile environment employing scrum methodology and JIRA as a SDLC management tool.

Automated Testing
Advanced

Test Automation

JOB DESCRIPTION

About the role

We’re on a mission to redefine battlefield management for modern operations - and we need a quality-focused, self-driven QA Engineer to help us get there.

At our innovative startup, we’re building a next-gen Battlefield Management System that merges Android mobile apps (built with Flutter), a robust Java backend, and real-world hardware components like radios, sensors, and weather stations. Designed for use in high-risk environments, this platform must meet the highest standards for security, performance, and reliability - and that’s where you come in.

Requirements

4+ years in QA roles, with experience in both manual and automated testing.
Deep understanding of mobile testing best practices, especially for Android platforms.
Experience testing RESTful APIs and backend systems.
Solid grasp of Agile workflows and cross-functional collaboration.
Proven ability to work independently and proactively drive testing efforts.
Strong English communication skills (written & spoken).

Nice to have:

Experience with hardware integration (e.g., radios, sensors, weather stations).
Background in high-security, mission-critical, or military-grade software.
Knowledge of penetration testing and security best practices.

Responsibilities

As the QA Engineer, you’ll take end-to-end ownership of our testing lifecycle, covering both manual and automated testing across a complex ecosystem. You’ll work closely with developers, product managers, and domain experts to ensure our system performs flawlessly under pressure.

Your responsibilities will include:

Test Strategy & Execution: Design and maintain test plans, test cases, and test scenarios.
Functional & Technical Testing: Perform system, integration, regression, and security testing across mobile (Android), backend (Java), and hardware components.
Automation: Build and maintain automated test suites using tools like Appium, Flutter Driver, or Espresso.
Mobile Testing: Conduct hands-on testing across Android devices, ensuring cross-platform consistency.
API Testing: Validate RESTful APIs and ensure reliable communication between frontend and backend.
Performance Testing: Assess app responsiveness and stability under real-world conditions, including variable networks and hardware states.
Collaboration: Partner with developers and stakeholders in Agile ceremonies to ensure quality from design through delivery.
Scenario Writing: Author precise, real-world test cases reflecting both standard and edge-use scenarios.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Andersen is looking for a QA Automation Engineer (Java) for a project with an international banking group. The role focuses on testing digital banking solutions, mainly in the retail sector. 

 

The customer is a leading international banking group, operating for over four decades across the Middle East, North Africa, Europe, the Americas, and Asia. The organization provides a wide range of services, including corporate banking, trade finance, treasury solutions, Islamic banking, and retail banking, with physical branches in five countries and a fast-growing fully digital mobile bank. It is recognized for its commitment to digital transformation through dedicated innovation units and digital platforms, including a fully digital retail bank. 

 

The project is focused on enhancing digital banking channels and expanding online banking services. A key area of development is the retail segment, where the team will work on improving and delivering new digital solutions to enhance the customer experience and broaden the bank’s retail offerings. 

 

Responsibilities:  

- Developing and executing test scripts for products while identifying deficiencies. 

- Suggesting solutions to identified product problems. 

- Investigating product quality to implement improvements for enhanced customer satisfaction. 

- Collaborating with the Product Development team to ensure consistent project execution. 

- Identifying quality assurance process bottlenecks and proposing improvement actions. 

- Collecting quality data. 

- Determining key KPIs for product quality. 

- Preparing and presenting reports and metrics to Senior Management. 

- Coordinating with UAT teams to maintain consistent project execution. 

 

Must-haves: 

- Experience as a QA for 2+ years. 

- Experience with coding using Java. 

- Experience with software QA tools and processes. 

- Familiarity with continuous integration tools such as Jenkins. 

- Experience in using Jira and confluence. 

- Critical thinker and problem-solving skills. 

- Strong communication and documentation skills. 

- Ability to drive to goals and milestones while valuing and maintaining a strong attention to details. 

- Level of English – from Intermediate+ and above. 

 

Nice-to-haves: 

- Proficiency in scripting languages including Bash and Python. 

- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. 

 

Reasons why this job would be interesting to you: 

- Experience in teamwork with leaders in FinTech, Healthcare, Retail, Telecom, and others. Andersen cooperates with such businesses as Samsung, Siemens, Johnson & Johnson, BNP Paribas, Ryanair, Mercedes, TUI, Verivox, Allianz, T-Systems, etc.. 

- The opportunity to change the project and/or develop expertise in an interesting business domain. 

- Job conditions – you can work both fully remotely and from the office or can choose a hybrid variant. 

- Guarantee of professional, financial, and career growth! The company has introduced systems of mentoring and adaptation for each new employee. 

- The opportunity to earn up to an additional 1,000 EUR per month, depending on the level of expertise, which will be included in the annual bonus, by participating in the company's activities. 

- Access to the corporate training portal, where the entire knowledge base of the company is collected and which is constantly updated. 

- Bright corporate life (parties / pizza days / PlayStation / fruits / coffee / snacks / movies). 

- Certification compensation (AWS, PMP, etc). 

- Referral program. 

- English courses. 

- Private health insurance and compensation for sports activities. 




Your personal data is protected in accordance with GDPR regulations. Learn more: https://andersenlab.com/privacy-policy/pl

 

Join us!

JOB DESCRIPTION

QA Automation Engineer

100% REMOTE




KIM JESTEŚMY?




ALTEN – Światowy lider usług inżynieryjnych i IT

Grupa ALTEN, założona w 1988 roku we Francji, jest wiodącym partnerem technologicznym, obsługującym największych klientów na świecie. W 2023 roku osiągnęła przychody przekraczające 4,07 miliarda euro i zatrudnia ponad 57 000 pracowników, w tym 88% inżynierów i ekspertów IT. ALTEN Polska działa od 13 lat, wspierając innowacje, badania i rozwój oraz systemy IT swoich klientów. Posiada biura w Krakowie, Warszawie, Wrocławiu, Gdańsku i Poznaniu. Obsługuje kluczowe branże, takie jak lotnicza, kosmiczna, przemysłowa, motoryzacyjna, kolejowa, energetyczna, finansowa, telekomunikacyjna i sprzedażowa. Zakres ekspertyzy: analiza biznesowa, cyberbezpieczeństwo, sztuczna inteligencja, analiza danych i rozwiązania chmurowe, rozwój aplikacji, testowanie oprogramowania, zarządzanie projektami, oprogramowanie wbudowane, zarządzanie jakością, industrializacja, transformacja cyfrowa oraz inżynieria przemysłowa.

Więcej informacji na http://www.altenpolska.pl




Poszukiwany: QA Engineer (Test Automation) – Zespoły rozwojowo-utrzymaniowe




Do jednego z naszych projektów poszukujemy QA Engineera ze znajomością JavaScript/TypeScript oraz doświadczeniem w automatyzacji testów. Osoba na tym stanowisku będzie wspierać rozwój i utrzymanie produktu w zwinnej strukturze, w oparciu o pipeline CI/CD, zapewniając wysoką jakość dostarczanego oprogramowania.




KLUCZOWE ZADANIA:

Współtworzenie zespołu rozwijającego i utrzymującego produkt.

Zapewnienie jakości w procesie wytwórczym opartym o podejście zwinne i CI/CD.

Projektowanie, wdrażanie i utrzymywanie testów automatycznych (głównie regresyjnych).

Testowanie nowych funkcjonalności – automatycznie i manualnie – w dwutygodniowych sprintach.

Analiza pokrycia testami i identyfikacja luk w procesach QA.

Badanie i debugowanie defektów.




WYMAGANIA:

Min. 3 lata doświadczenia w automatyzacji testów.

Bardzo dobra znajomość JavaScript/TypeScript.

Doświadczenie z przynajmniej jednym frameworkiem testowym: Playwright (preferowany), Selenium, Appium, WebdriverIO, TestNG.

Znajomość narzędzi do zarządzania testami: JIRA, GitLab, Xray.

Umiejętność debugowania i analizy błędów testów automatycznych.

Znajomość Git oraz doświadczenie w testach funkcjonalnych i niefunkcjonalnych.

Znajomość języka angielskiego na poziomie umożliwiającym pracę z dokumentacją.

Znajomość Postmana i testowania API.




CO MOŻEMY CI ZAOFEROWAĆ?




DNA ALTEN łączy w sobie ludzkie wartości, kulturę doskonałości i doświadczenie w służbie swoim klientom. Oferujemy indywidualne podejście do każdego pracownika w duchu work-life balance. Kładziemy nacisk na odpowiedzialny, zrównoważony rozwój i proekologiczne rozwiązania.




Oferujemy:

▪ Umowę na pełen etat z możliwością wyboru formy zatrudnienia (UoP/B2B)

▪ Udział w konferencjach branżowych, szkoleniach i warsztatach oraz spotkaniach integracyjnych

▪ Możliwość odbycia kursów i zdobycia certyfikacji

▪ Możliwość relokacji w ramach lokalnych oddziałów ALTEN Polska




BENEFITY

▪ Prywatna opieka medyczna Medicover

▪ Prywatna opieka dentystyczna Medicover

▪ Platforma zakupowa Medicover Benefits / karta sportowa Medicover

▪ Program poleceń pracowników ALTEN Talenty

▪ Wyprawka dla nowonarodzonego dziecka pracownika

▪ Ubezpieczenie grupowe na życie

▪ Możliwość udziału w programie emerytalnym




Dołącz do naszego zespołu i razem z nami twórz przyszłość technologii już dziś!




Klikając w przycisk „Wyślij” zgadzasz się na przetwarzanie przez Alten Polska sp. z o.o. z siedzibą w Warszawie Twoich danych osobowych zawartych w zgłoszeniu rekrutacyjnym w celu prowadzenia rekrutacji na stanowisko wskazane w ogłoszeniu.

W każdym momencie możesz cofnąć zgodę, kontaktując się z nami pod adresem ALTEN_PL_RODO@alten.com, co oznacza zakończenie rekrutacji i nieuwzględnienie Twojej kandydatury przy przyszłych rekrutacjach.




Pełną informację odnośnie przetwarzania Twoich danych osobowych znajdziesz https://docs.altenpolska.pl/do_pobrania/Klauzula_informacyjna_dla_potencjalnych_pracownikow.pdf




UWAGA: Uprzejmie informujemy, że skontaktujemy się z wybranymi kandydatami

Published: 24.08.2025
MEET THE COMPANY
ALTEN Polska

Jesteśmy częścią ALTEN Group, utworzonej w 1988 roku we Francji i mającej siedziby w 30 krajach. Grupa ALTEN przez 35 lat ugruntowała swoją pozycję światowego lidera w dziedzinie inżynierii i usług IT.Wspieramy kluczowych graczy w branżach: lotniczej, kosmicznej, obronnej, morskiej, motoryzacyjnej, kolejowej, energetycznej, finansowej, telekomunikacyjnej, sprzedażowej i biomedycznej.Przy obrotach finansowych przekraczających 4 miliardy euro w 2024 roku, ALTEN zatrudnia obecnie ponad 57 700 pracowników na całym świecie.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Andersen is hiring a Junior QA Automation Engineer (C#) in the EU for a large-scale project with a German tech leader. The role involves testing a chatbot integrated with Microsoft Teams to enhance user experience and productivity through AI support. 

 

The customer is a German company, one of the leading global developers of innovative technologies. The company works with all big names in the automotive industry (Audi, Bentley, BMW, Bosch, Bugatti, Chrysler, Fiat, Volkswagen, Ford, Honda, Mercedes-Benz) and the research sector. And it is involved from initial conceptualization to real-life road testing.  

 

The project is the development of a chatbot integrated into the client’s application within Microsoft Teams. It functions as a web app powered by ChatGPT, designed to assist users through conversational interactions, streamline workflows, and enhance productivity directly within the Teams environment. 

 

Responsibilities: 

Creating and executing automated and manual tests to verify the functionality, performance, and security of the software. 

Writing scripts for automated tests using appropriate tools and programming languages 

Detecting, documenting, and tracking defects and issues in the software, ensuring they are fixed before the product release. 

Working closely with developers, business analysts, and other team members to understand requirements and ensure the software meets specifications. 

 

Must-haves: 

Experience in QA for 6+ months. 

Experience in programming languages such as C#. 

Experience with automation testing tools and frameworks like xUnit, NUnit, NuGet. 

Knowledge of version control systems such as Git. 

Knowledge (and experience) in Azure. 

Familiarity with CI/CD tools like GitLab CI. 

Strong understanding of software testing principles, methodologies, and best practices. 

Knowledge of different types of testing (functional, regression, load, security, API). 

Experience with test management tools like Jira and TestRail. 

Level of English – from Intermediate and above. 

 

Reasons why this job would be interesting to you: 

Experience in teamwork with leaders in FinTech, Healthcare, Retail, Telecom, and others. Andersen cooperates with such businesses as Samsung, Siemens, Johnson & Johnson, BNP Paribas, Ryanair, Mercedes, TUI, Verivox, Allianz, T-Systems, etc.; 

The opportunity to change the project and/or develop expertise in an interesting business domain; 

Job conditions – you can work both fully remotely and from the office or can choose a hybrid variant; 

Guarantee of professional, financial, and career growth! The company has introduced systems of mentoring and adaptation for each new employee; 

The opportunity to earn additional up to 1,000 EUR per month by participating in the company's activities; 

Access to the corporate training portal, where the entire knowledge base of the company is collected and which is constantly updated; 

Bright corporate life (parties / pizza days / PlayStation / fruits / coffee / snacks / movies); 

Certification compensation (AWS, PMP, etc); 

Referral program; 

English courses; 

Private health insurance and compensation for sports activities. 




Your personal data is protected in accordance with GDPR regulations.

Learn more: https://andersenlab.com/privacy-policy/pl

JOB DESCRIPTION

AgileEngine is an Inc. 5000 company that creates award-winning software for Fortune 500 brands and trailblazing startups across 17+ industries. We rank among the leaders in areas like application development and AI/ML, and our people-first culture has earned us multiple Best Place to Work awards.




Why join us

If you're looking for a place to grow, make an impact, and work with people who care, we'd love to meet you! :)




About the role

We’re looking for a QA Automation Engineer to join a digital platform that’s transforming land and livestock management. You’ll contribute to both new feature development and ongoing support, working with a modern tech stack (JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Mapbox, MUI) and collaborating with a skilled Scrum team.




This role is a chance to make a real impact by delivering value to end-users, shaping testing strategies, and driving innovation in a product that promotes sustainability and smarter farm management.







What you will do




Plan, write, review, and execute test plans throughout the development life cycle;

Ensure test plans thoroughly cover all requirements and use cases;

Develop automated tests for the most important test suites and set up those under CI/CD;

Actively participate in the scrum team events;

Foster a continuous improvement approach to QA activities;

Manual testing, especially when there are no automation tests yet.




Must haves




4+ years of commercial experience in automation testing using JavaScript/TypeScript;

Experience with end-to-end testing using Cypress/similar tool;

Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines;

Strong communication skills with excellent interpersonal effectiveness;

Upper-Intermediate English Level.




Nice to haves




Experience working with Azure DevOps and Azure DevOps Boards.




The benefits of joining us




Professional growth

Accelerate your professional journey with mentorship, TechTalks, and personalized growth roadmaps




Competitive compensation

We match your ever-growing skills, talent, and contributions with competitive USD-based compensation and budgets for education, fitness, and team activities




A selection of exciting projects

Join projects with modern solutions development and top-tier clients that include Fortune 500 enterprises and leading product brands




Flextime

Tailor your schedule for an optimal work-life balance, by having the options of working from home and going to the office – whatever makes you the happiest and most productive.







Meet Our Recruitment Process




Asynchronous stage – An automated, self-paced track that helps us move faster and give you quicker feedback:

Short online form to confirm basic requirements

30–60 minute skills assessment

5-minute introduction video




Synchronous stage – Live interviews

Technical interview with our engineering team (scheduled at your convenience)

Final interview with your future teammates




If it’s a match — you’ll get an offer!
